feed.subtitle: SAP HANA Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Profit Center Group is not available in Standard Hierarchy Node
entry.content:
Hello,

In SAP Cloud, I am unable to create a Profit Center since the Standard Hierarchy Node list is blank. I tried creating a Profit Center Group hierarchy in the Manage Global Hierarchies app but it does not show up. The Profit Center Group is activated. What needs to be done in order for the Profit Center Group to become available to use?

In the screenshot, I used GLOBAL as the ID. I've also tried creating this as YBPH and this doesn't work either.

entry.title: Do we have to import lets encrypt root CA on HANA 2.0?
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

We are currently transitioning our TLS certificate root CA. Previously, we used DigiCert Global Root G2 to sign our TLS certificates. We are now in the process of switching our root CA to Let's Encrypt ISRG Root X1.

Our previous setup https://me.sap.com/notes/3400997  involves. We need to establish a secure connection using this new certificate chain.

I am wondering if we need to follow a similar process as described in the SAP Help Portal documentation for importing root CAs: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_HANA_PLATFORM/6b94445c94ae495c83a19646e7c3fd56/86e96624e9a74e77994f7544db51061c.html?q=certificate+CA 

SAP HANA Enterprise Cloud

entry.title: HDI access on Database explorer for CAP services
entry.content:
Hi experts,

Developers used to access HDI containers part of CAP services over Database Explorer. For this, they only thing required is to grant the Cloud Foundry Developer role developers in the space where the HDI is deployed. 

Now, we do not want to grant the Cloud Foundry Developer role to developers but we still would like to grant access to developers to the HDI over the Database explorer. How can we achieve this?

Note that we may not want to grant write permission to developers so we may not want to assign directly the HDI:access:role to users.

Many thanks!

C.

entry.title: How to Get Remaining Balance for Specific Line Item of an Invoice or Advance
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I‚Äôm trying to get a report in SAP that shows the remaining balance against a particular line item of an invoice or advance payment.

I have already tried the following:

  • J3RFPCR ‚Äì This only shows the original payment document for Special G/L indicator ‚ÄòA‚Äô (Down Payments) but not for other types of transactions.

  • S_ALR_87012105 ‚Äì This doesn‚Äôt provide the line-item level remaining balance information I‚Äôm looking for.

üëâ Internally, the system is working correctly ‚Äì when I run F-53 (Post Outgoing Payment), SAP perfectly shows how much balance is left against that line item and how much I have already adjusted. But I need a report or transaction to view this information directly without going into F-53.

What I need is:

‚úÖ A standard report or method to get the remaining open amount for each line item in an invoice/advance (not just at header level).
‚úÖ Ability to see it for all Special G/L indicators, not just for ‚ÄòA‚Äô.

Is there any:

  • Standard report or transaction code?

  • Table combination or query that can achieve this?

  • Or do I need to go for a custom report? - I have tried table level but didn't get it, BSE_CLR, BSEG

Any suggestions or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Datasphere - HANA Cloud DB Remote Table (Insufficient privileges on HDI)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We have created a connection in Datasphere to visualize the access to a HANA Cloud DB.

The set up is correct and we are able to import the relevant tables as remote tables but when we are trying to view the data we are getting the error as follows:

internal error: Error opening the cursor for the remote database <DWC_IL_BTP_HANA_APPS_EU.HANA_BTP_APPS_EU> [SAP AG][LIBODBCHDB SO][HDBODBC] General error;258 insufficient privilege: Detailed info for this error can be found with guid 'E3A628E32FA90D4B90B99370A3C9CBC4'

The issue is due to insufficient privileges of the user used in the Datasphere connection (DBAMIN) to access the HDI container where the table exist.

I understand that to solve the issue we need to assigned SELECT privilege to DBADMIN on the respective schema but, how can we do that?

Note that the HDI container has been created over an MTA so not sure how we can do to grant that permission.

Many thanks!

C.

entry.title: HANA Client for Node.js and explicit connection pooling
entry.content:
Hello,

I ran some experiments with the explicit connection pool API of the HANA client for Node.js:

createPool({String | Object}[, Object]) Method | SAP Help Portal

When I create a connection pool with these pool options:

{
  maxConnectedOrPooled: 10,
  poolCapacity: 1, 
  maxPooledIdleTime: 60,
  pingCheck: true,
}

and watch the network connections of the node process e. g. with `lsof -i -a -p <pid>` I can see that the pool keeps one connection open with the database at all times, which is what I expect.

But if the connection is idle for longer then 60s, it is still kept open. Only once I do another request and a connection is to be taken from the pool, it evicts the old connection and creates a new one.
 
For me this defies the purpose of the connection pool to always have a usable connection available. It also makes no sense from a resource point of view to keep a connection open which is never to be reused!
 
I expect that many developers will take the code from the documentation page
var pool = hana.createPool("ServerNode=myhost-hanacloud.ondemand.com:443;uid=myusername;pwd=mypassword",
"poolCapacity=25;maxConnectedOrPooled=50;maxPooledIdleTime=60;pingCheck=true");

Not only does it specify a pool capacity of 25 idle, 50 total which is too high for most applications. It also leads to having up to 25 connections open with the database which, after 60s, will be completely useless since they all will be evicted the next time a connection is to be retrieved from the pool. I tested this.

So, is the HANA Client broken for maxPooledIdleTime?

entry.title: Documentation on Tode - FBDC
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are considering adding a filter in the workflow based on Tcode- FBDC. However, we are unable to find any documentation from SAP that ‚ÄúFBDC‚Äù is the only transaction code that manual JEs are posted. We would appreciate if anyone can help us with links on "FBDC" only. Kindly note we do have documentation on T-codes such as FBDC_P051, FBDC_P050, FBDC_P060 etc.

Note - We are working in S/4 Hana Public Cloud

Regards,
Abha Hardikar

entry.title: In Freight Pricing Condition what is the difference between the "Account" and "Accrual"
entry.content: It was my understanding that in OBYC you set up in "Account" column should post to the freight expense account and the TRNx set up in the "Accrual" column would post to the Freight clearing account.  These postings I thought would occur during a Goods Receipt.  What really happens with the GR is that it posts to whatever TRNx is aligned in the "Accrual" column.  GR seems to completely ignore the "Account" column

I've tried connecting via dbapi.connect, but I'm lost when I found out it had a Zscaler Proxy.
Thank you in advance for the help.

SAP HANA Enterprise Cloud

entry.title: HDI deployment error : deployed file already provides it, Could not compose a consistent make graph
entry.content:
getting this error while subscribing a new tenant to our application.

the deployed file already provides it Could not compose a consistent make graph Calculating dependencies... failed Making... failed Starting make in the container "6D29AE79357049B781C527A584B55E75" with 13 files to deploy, 0 files to undeploy... failed'' at module.exports [as _UPDATE] (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds/libx/_runtime/db/generic/update.js:95:9) at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5) at async next (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/srv/srv-dispatch.js:69:17) at async HanaDatabase.handle (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/srv/srv-dispatch.js:67:10) at async retry (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds-mtxs/lib/utils.js:46:14) at async pickJob (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds-mtxs/srv/jobs-service.js:171:5)

Could you help me understand what could be the reasons getting this error ? sometimes the error doesnt show up while subscribing, but shows up while upgrading the tenant.

not sure which files to share, repo here https://github.tools.sap/one-sm/supplier-syndication

entry.title: CPU/Memory utilization monitoring and Workload class
entry.content:
Introduction

This document explains how to monitor resource usage in an SAP HANA system, focusing specifically on CPU utilization. Regular monitoring ensures your system runs efficiently, maintains high performance, and uses resources wisely helping to avoid slowdowns and unnecessary costs.

Monitoring CPU Usage in SAP HANA Cloud

SAP HANA Cloud offers multiple tools for monitoring system performance. One of the most accessible and useful is SAP HANA Cloud Central. Follow the steps below to monitor CPU usage effectively:

 

Step 1: Open SAP HANA Cockpit

  • Go to SAP HANA Cloud Central.

  • Right-click on your HANA instance and select "Open SAP HANA Cockpit."

    Step 2: Navigate to CPU Usage

    • In the Cockpit, open the Performance Monitor.

    •  

    • Click on CPU Usage to view current and historical CPU activity.

      Step 3: Analyze the Data

      • Review CPU usage trends over time to identify patterns.

      • Pay close attention to spikes in usage to pinpoint potential performance issues.

        Additional Tools for Monitoring Performance

        Beyond CPU usage, the Performance Monitor provides visibility into other key resources and activities that impact system performance:

        • Expensive Statements: SQL queries that consume high levels of resources. These should be analyzed and optimized first.

        • Running Statements: Shows currently running SQL statements and their resource usage.

        • Alerts: System-generated warnings about unusual activity or performance issues.

        • Background Jobs: Scheduled processes that may impact CPU and memory usage.

          By identifying expensive statements, you can see exactly which queries are causing heavy load, when they ran, and what SQL code was executed. This information is crucial for performance tuning.

          After identifying these queries, you can optimize them‚Äîeither by improving the SQL logic or by adjusting execution times‚Äîso that not all resource-heavy tasks run at the same time. This ensures resources are available for other important or ad hoc operations.

          Managing Resource Consumption with Workload Classes

          To prevent system overloads, one effective strategy is to use Workload Classes. These allow you to set limits on resource usage, such as CPU or memory, ensuring that no user or query consumes more than its fair share.

          What is a Workload Class?

          A workload class defines specific rules for resource usage. When applied, it helps:

          • Prevent overutilization of system resources,

          • Maintain system stability and performance,

          • Allocate resources more fairly across users and tasks.

            Creating a Workload Class

            You can create a workload class either through SAP HANA Cockpit or by using an SQL statement. Once created, it must be assigned to a user to take effect.

            Example 1: Using SQL

             

             
            CREATE WORKLOAD CLASS "SHIGI" SET 'ADMISSION CONTROL REJECT CONTROL REJECT CPU THRESHLD' = '45';

             

             
            Example 2: More Detailed Workload Class

             

             
            CREATE WORKLOAD CLASS MyWorkloadClass STATEMENT MEMORY LIMIT 1 GB STATEMENT THREAD LIMIT 5 STATEMENT QUEUE TIMEOUT 60 SECONDS PRIORITY MEDIUM;
             

            How It Works

            Once a workload class is assigned to a user:

            • Any SQL statement that exceeds the defined limits (CPU, memory, threads, etc.) will be automatically rejected.

            • This ensures critical system resources remain available and protects the system from crashing due to overload.

              Conclusion

              Monitoring and managing resource usage in SAP HANA Cloud is essential for maintaining performance and stability. By regularly checking CPU and memory consumption, identifying expensive queries, and using workload classes, you can keep your system healthy and efficient‚Äîno matter how demanding the workload.

entry.title: S/4HANA Cloud: Question about Application Job Exclusivity/Mutual Exclusion
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have a question regarding the exclusivity of application jobs in SAP S/4HANA  Public Cloud.

I'm aware that some standard application jobs cannot be executed simultaneously, which suggests a form of mutual exclusion or locking mechanism is in place. However, I'm trying to understand if this exclusivity applies to all application jobs or if it's limited to specific job templates.

I've been looking for official documentation to clarify this, but I'm also very interested in hearing from anyone who has experience or knowledge on this topic. Any insights from your own projects or a link to a relevant resource would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your help.

entry.title: Finding more details for Error code 2
entry.content:
Hi team,

Recently we had a bug during Hana Cloud migration dry run when executing statement:

CREATE TYPE "IDStringType" AS TABLE (
        IDX INTEGER,
        STRING_COLUMN NVARCHAR(5000)
);

Unfortunately the only error log I could find was that it failed with error code 2.
Is there a way to find more details about this error in this Hana Cloud DB? It seems like in addition to the error code there's supposed to be an error message giving you more details but for some reason I only got "DbError" on grafana.

Thank you.

entry.title: How to use SAP hana-client module with Vite / SvelteKit?
entry.content:
Hi all,

I've been trying to use @SAP/hana-client module on a SvelteKit project (which bundles everything using Vite). With default configs, it runs fine on dev mode (no SSR/prerendering). However, when trying to build the app, it throws an exception trying to prerender the binary blobs, which is expected. When instructing Vite not to prerender the lib, there are errors on the import, as it is a CommonJS module and was not "ESM-ized" by Vite build process. We then need to import it as "import * as hana from (...)" instead of "import hana from (...)", as it says the module doesn't have a default export, which makes the app finally build, but then breaks the dev mode, because createPool() is now undiscoverable in ESM mode. Also, dev mode only runs if the "ssr" config (see below) is not used, or else it gives an error trying to use require(), which is not defined on ESM mode.

Is there a way users are supposed to handle the combination of CommonJS + binary blobs? Are there plans of migrating the lib to standard ESM?

The Vite configs (vite.config.ts) used to ignore the module on prerendering are:

  ssr: {
    noExternal: ["@sap/hana-client"],
  },
  optimizeDeps: {
    exclude: ['@sap/hana-client']  // don't try to pre-bundle it
  },
  build: {
    rollupOptions: {
      plugins: [
        commonjs({
          ignoreDynamicRequires: true
        })
      ]
    }
  },

 Thanks in advance,
Lawisch

entry.title: Deployed CAP+Fiori App is running, but UI gives 404 on metadata call and is not visible in Work Zone
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm developing a full-stack application in SAP Business Application Studio and I'm facing a final issue after a seemingly successful deployment to Cloud Foundry.

My Project Setup:

  • Backend: SAP CAP with Node.js

  • Database: SAP HANA Cloud, using synonyms to access tables from another container.

  • Frontend: SAP Fiori Elements (List Report Object Page template).

  • Security: Using a standard XSUAA service.

  • Deployment Target: The final goal is to integrate the app into our SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

The Problem / Observed Behavior: The deployment to Cloud Foundry using cf deploy completes 100% successfully. In the CF space, I can see that my applications (-srv, -ui) are in the "Started" state, and the -db-deployer is "Stopped", which is the expected behavior.

The issue is that the application is unreachable and invisible to end-users:

  1. When I access the direct URL of the CAP backend service (...-srv.cfapps...), I correctly see the CAP welcome page listing my service endpoint at /odata/v4/catalog. This confirms the backend is alive and serving the correct path.

  2. However, when I access the main UI application URL (...-ui.cfapps...), the page title loads, but the rest of the page is blank.

  3. Checking the browser's developer console, I see a 404 (Not Found) error when the application tries to fetch the service metadata. The failing request is: GET .../odata/v4/catalog/$metadata.

  4. Consequently, the application does not appear in the Content Explorer of the SAP Build Work Zone after refreshing the "HTML5 Apps" content provider.

My Question: What could be the reason for the 404 Not Found error during the metadata call from the UI, given that the deployment is successful and the backend service is confirmed to be running and serving the correct path? It seems there is a routing or communication issue between the AppRouter (-ui app) and the CAP service (-srv app) that I am unable to diagnose further.

Relevant Configuration Files attached
